GameEngine

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameEngine.GameController

  • public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameController class is responsible for saving game states after every move. It also assists in managing the resume and undo operations.
    Author:
    adsrc, brihijoshi

      • GameController

        public GameController(java.util.ArrayList<Player> _players,
                      Grid _grid,
                      GameState _gameState,
                      boolean _resume)
        Parametrised constructor
        Parameters:
        _players - ArrayList of the Player objects in the game
        _grid - The Grid object of the game
        _gameState - The current serializable state of the game
        _resume - Whether the game is a resumed instance or a fresh game

    • Method Detail

      • convert_index

        public static int[] convert_index(int numCols)
        This method returns the 2-D indices of a given GUI component in the GridPane. The GridPane that has been used for a grid in the GUI of the game stores the StackPane representing each cell in a 1-D array. From it, we need to retrieve corresponding 2-D coordinates to update the Grid object. This is achieved by this function. It achieves this by using the _index attribute and the number of columns in the GUI grid which is passed as parameters.
        Parameters:
        numCols - The number of columns in a row of the GUI grid
        Returns:
        An integer array containing the 2-D coordinates of the corresponding Cell object

      • get_gameState

        public GameState get_gameState()
        Returns:
        returns the current GameState object

      • get_grid

        public Grid get_grid()
        Returns:
        a Grid object representing the current GUI grid

      • get_index

        public static int get_index()
        Returns:
        get the index of the StackPane that has been pressed in the GUI

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> get_players()
        Returns:

        public void handleGame()
        Handler function for the taketurn(x, y) function.

      • is_endGame

        public boolean is_endGame()
        Returns:
        a boolean value to indicate whether the game is at an end condition

      • is_resume

        public boolean is_resume()
        Returns:
        returns true is the game is a resumed instance, else false

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(int x_index,
                       int y_index)
        Indicates whether the given 2-D coordinates are valid in the _grid of the class. In order to figure out how many neighbours does the cell have, we use this function as a helper and check the validity of all possible neighbour coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x_index - The x-coordinate of the cell
        y_index - The y-coordinate of the cell
        Returns:
        Boolean value indicating validity of the cell

      • loadGameState

        public void loadGameState()
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method de-serializes the saved GameState object from the "game.ser" file and re-attaches it to the GameController. It is invoked in case the user wants to resume a previously unfinished game. It follows the Decorator design pattern.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case the file to load from does not exist
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - In case there is a mismatch of objects de-serialized and the ones we are expecting

      • loadUndoState

        public GameState loadUndoState()
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method de-serializes the saved GameState object from the "undo.ser" file and returns it. It is invoked in case the player wants to undo his played move and attempt again. It follows the Decorator design pattern.
        Returns:
        The de-serialized GameState of the saved instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case the file to load from does not exist
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - In case there is a mismatch of classes

      • saveGameState

        public void saveGameState()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method saves the state of the GUI grid in a serializable format at the end of every turn. It's purpose is to create a state to be retrieved in case the player wants to resume the game after an unexpected exit. It follows the Decorator design pattern.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case the file to write to does not exist

      • saveUndoState

        public void saveUndoState()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method saves the state of the GUI grid in a serializable format at the end of every turn. It's purpose is to create a state to be retrieved in case the player wants to undo his played move and attempt again. It follows the Decorator design pattern.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case the file to write to does not exist

      • taketurn

        public void taketurn(int x,
                     int y)
        A function to simulate a game turn on the _grid of the class. Made for testing out our logic
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the pressed cell
        y - The y-coordinate of the pressed cell
